title: Automated Release Pipeline
description: Build a complete GitHub Actions workflow that automates the entire release process from version tagging to store deployment with quality gates.
instructions:
Create a comprehensive automated release pipeline:

1. Set up GitHub Actions workflow triggered by version tags (v*.*.*)
2. Implement version extraction from tag and validation
3. Run full test suite as quality gate before building
4. Generate changelog from conventional commits since last tag
5. Build Android App Bundle and iOS IPA in parallel
6. Upload debug symbols to Crashlytics automatically
7. Deploy Android to Play Store Internal track
8. Deploy iOS to TestFlight
9. Create GitHub Release with changelog and artifacts
10. Send Slack notification with release summary
11. Add manual approval step before production promotion
12. Implement rollback workflow for failed releases

Reference the deployment patterns from Module 16 for CI/CD best practices.

hints.text: Use GITHUB_REF_NAME to get the tag name, then strip the 'v' prefix with ${GITHUB_REF_NAME#v}
For changelog generation, use git log --pretty=format:'%s' $PREVIOUS_TAG..HEAD and filter with grep -E '^(feat|fix|perf)'
Use the 'environment: production' key with branch protection rules to require manual approval before promoting to production

commonMistakes.mistake: Not caching Flutter SDK and dependencies between jobs
commonMistakes.consequence: Each job downloads Flutter from scratch, wasting 2-3 minutes per job
commonMistakes.correction: Use actions/cache to cache ~/.pub-cache and the Flutter SDK directory

commonMistakes.mistake: Hardcoding version numbers in the workflow instead of extracting from tag
commonMistakes.consequence: Version mismatch between tag and built artifacts
commonMistakes.correction: Extract version from tag and pass as output to subsequent jobs
